models = {} for j, column in enumerate(columns): column_df = df[column] X = column_df.values

models[column] = model return models

if model is not None: if model_type == "KMeans": result = model[column].predict(X.reshape(-1,1))
if model_type == "PolynomialFeatures": result = model[column].transform(X.reshape(-1,1)).tolist() else: result = X
# compute feature histogram #counts, bin_edges = np.histogram(result, bins=bins[j], density=False) #column_hist = counts
# compute normalized feature histogram counts, bin_edges = np.histogram(result, bins=bins[j], density=True) column_hist = counts * np.diff(bin_edges)
row.extend(column_hist)
# add extra features kurtosis = st.kurtosis(X.reshape(-1,1))[0] skew = st.skew(X.reshape(-1,1))[0] min_value = column_df.min() max_value = column_df.max() mean_value = column_df.mean() median_value = column_df.median() row.extend([kurtosis, skew, min_value, max_value, mean_value, median_value]) return row

data[i] = row return data #-------------------------------------------------------------
